intro: Microseris pygmaea, commonly known as the dwarf rockcress, is a small, flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with characteristic four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are basal and linear, while its flowers are small and white or pale yellow. Microseris pygmaea is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along stream banks.
